page.title: 04 ONCHORS FARM
page.content: The name Onchors dates back to 1380.The farm was named after someone called Ankior.In 1973 the farm land only extended for 435 acres. The farm land now covers 1010 acres. Crops , Winter Wheat, Winter Barley, Winter Rape, Winter Beans, Spring Beans, Spring Barley and maize and spinneys cover 826 acres. Buildings, grass land, woodland and spinneys cover 177 acres. There are 7 houses and 15 farm buildings on the site. One of the farm buildings holds machinary. Others hold crop fertiliser or are used as grain stores. One of the grain stores can hold almost 40 tons of barley and 45 tons of wheat. The owner of Onchors Farm, Mr Bucknell has 20 cattle. He has a farming partnership with his father and brother, who use his grazing land for fattening their own cattle.Six workers are employed here.
